pageContext.description: Width as: "Head 16 mm; neck above swelling, 6 mm; swelling [?], 8.7 mm, Thickness as: "shank, 5.5 mm; tip, 3.5 mm", Horizontal perforation through swollen neck; [...] Ornament
pageContext.patina: fairly heavy + green, but slightly corroded
pageContext.other: Apologies for transcription errors, was written with a blunt square nib and letters tightly together., The previous card's drawings may in fact be an extension of the drawings on this card.
pageContext.collection: British Museum  1954, 10-2, C.E. Baldwin, Esq., M.A. in 1929 Senior Science Master at St. Lawrence College (+ eyewitness of find), now (1939) Headmaster, The County School Camberley[?],  Surrey.
pageContext.site: England, Kent, Ramsgate, St. Laurence College (3), found in digging foundation for Biology Laboratory, March 1929: for details see publications
pageContext.remarks: Two other pins (1,2); pottery urn of Deverel (Late Bronze Age) type; […] teeth, + […] frg. of Bos Cougiforus [?] oweing teeth of mudllhorse […];  […] shells.  Not a cremation burial, but was intact in ground, with all three pins inside it (animal bones, […] […]) The excavation was apparently a store-hole, belonging to a settlement site.  Picardy’ type
